descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a small grid with two objects
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...multiply the grid size by its own size
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make different pattern figures using all colors but light blue

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...some squares of various colors on one half of the grid and some blue square that make a pattern on the opposite side of the grid.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...will be the size of grid with the light blue squares multiplied by the length of the grid with the light blue squares. So, for example, if the light blue squares are in a 4x4 grid, the output grid will be 16x16.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...replace each of the colored squares on the input grid with the light blue pattern but in the color of the square, then orient the pattern to correspond with the colored squares in the new grid.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...6x3  grid size, first 3x3 grid will have same color and another 3x3 grid will have another multi color pattern
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...will be size of light blue multiplied by number of blue grid
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...replace each of colored grid by light blue color grid pattern

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a small multicolor pattern
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...ignore the light blue, take the other colors, separate them and recreate the pattern of the light blue

annotated_phrases.phrase: some squares of various colors on one half of the grid and some blue square that make a pattern on the opposite side of the grid.
will be the size of grid with the light blue squares multiplied by the length of the grid with the light blue squares.
So, for example, if the light blue squares are in a 4x4 grid, the output grid will be 16x16.
replace each of the colored squares on the input grid with the light blue pattern but in the color of the square, then orient the pattern to correspond with the colored squares in the new grid.
